intro: Conyza sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran ironweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and serrated leaves. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a composite head, which attracts various pollinators. Conyza sumatrensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands and agricultural fields.
